column4: when I do a sudo monut -a  I get a error saying connection refused(mount error 111) refer to man mount.cifs) how do i fix this am i doing this right to mount a netowrk drive
mount -a tries to mount every drive listed in /etc/fstab
before I update ubuntu I have a mount to a mapped drive and now its gone when I sudo mouont -a it give me a error
what did you update?
distro upgrade?
where's the drive located?
how many comps?
it's a networked drive, right? can other comps access it?
why are you using samba with only one computer?
I can see the computer in places/network
before i updated it would automatically mouont now it dosent
mounting changed recently
if you look at /etc/fstab you mind find the drive still listed there, but commented out
you can fix it there if you know what you're doing
it is still there
most likely
I can see the computer when i go to places/network
irrelevant. the problem is in /etc/fstab
what should my entry in etc/fstab look like
what should my entry in etc/fstab look like
